title: Bolsonaro Says Mission Isn’t Over as US Conservatives Fete Him
description: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro got an enthusiastic welcome from US conservatives gathered in suburban Washington and said his “mission is not over” while leaving open the possibility that his movement might continue without him.

title: Zambia Asks UN’s Guterres to Assist in Debt Restructuring Talks
description: Zambia’s President Hakainde Hichilema asked United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres to help push for the conclusion of talks over the southern African nation’s debt restructuring.

title: Biden Closes In on Order to Restrict US Investment in China Tech
description: The Biden administration is nearing completion of an executive order that would restrict investments by US companies in parts of the Chinese economy, including advanced technologies that could enhance China’s military and intelligence capabilities, people familiar with the matter said.

title: More Iranian Schoolgirls Sickened in Suspected Poisoning Wave
description: Hundreds of schoolgirls were taken to hospitals across Iran on Saturday, state media reported, as suspected chemical attacks on the country’s girls schools continued.

title: Congo President Tells Macron Conflict in East May Delay Election
description: Violence in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo that’s displaced nearly 7 million people could delay elections scheduled for December, President Felix Tshisekedi told French President Emmanuel Macron.

title: Anti-ESG Crusader Wants to Take Trump’s Agenda to ‘Next Level’
description: Ohio biotech entrepreneur Vivek Ramaswamy is basing his long-shot Republican campaign for president in 2024 on persuading even hard-core supporters of Donald Trump that he can take the former president’s “America First” agenda “to the next level.”

title: Italy’s Meloni Defends Government Action After Sea Tragedy
description: Italy’s Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni has defended her government’s actions over the migrants shipwreck off the coast of Calabria, Southern Italy.

title: Turkey’s Erdogan Criticizes Rivals Over Candidate Squabbles
description: Turkish leader Recep Tayyip Erdogan accused his rivals of political squabbling after the opposition alliance failed to come up with a joint presidential candidate ahead of elections in May.

title: The G-20 Standoff and Fox’s Big Trump Admission: Weekend Reads
description: The thorny meeting of Group of 20 foreign ministers in New Delhi this week underscored just how fraught the world has become as richer nations who condemn Russia’s invasion of Ukraine fail to convince poorer ones from abandoning ties with Moscow.

title: Between Rounds of Golf, Trump’s Searching for the Perfect DeSantis Diss
description: Holed up at his resort in Palm Beach, Florida, former President Donald Trump spends many mornings golfing and then, in the afternoons, plots his political comeback.

title: Your Saturday UK Briefing: Sunak Chalks Up a Win as the Budget Looms
description: Follow us at  @BloombergUK and on  Facebook, and wrap up your day with The Readout newsletter with Allegra Stratton.

title: Iran Says Questions About Suspected Highly Enriched Uranium Are Resolved
description: Iran has settled concerns with international inspectors over its suspected enrichment of uranium to near weapons-grade purity, the head of Iran’s Atomic Energy Organization said.

title: China to Boost Defense Budget; EV Chiefs Give Advice: NPC Update
description: China’s annual National People’s Congress kicks off on Sunday morning, a key political event that promises a shakeup at the top echelons of government that could further consolidate President Xi Jinping’s power.

title: Philippine governor, 5 others killed in brazen attack
description: MANILA, Philippines (AP) — Gunmen in military uniforms fatally shot a governor and five civilians on Saturday while the provincial leader was meeting villagers at his home in the central Philippines, in the latest brazen assault on local politicians in the country, police said.

title: An Emboldened Rishi Sunak Gets Ready to Fight His Own Party Over Taxes
description: The prime minister has started to deliver on his promises to voters. Can he keep it going until the next general election?

title: Russia Is Getting Round Sanctions to Secure Supply of Key Chips for Ukraine War
description: Russia looks to be successfully working around European Union and Group of Seven sanctions to secure crucial semiconductors and other technologies for its war in Ukraine, according to a senior European diplomat.

title: China Defends Growing Military Budget Before Annual Congress
description: China needs to increase its military budget to meet “complex security challenges,” a top Chinese official said, amid rising geopolitical tensions with the US.

title: Ukraine Latest: Russia Continues Efforts to Encircle Bakhmut
description: Ukraine’s armed forces said Russian troops continue their bid to cut off Bakhmut. The comment comes a day after Yevgeny Prigozhin, founder of Russia’s Wagner mercenary group, released a video saying his units had “practically surrounded” the eastern Ukrainian city.

title: The UK Is Using Drones to Prosecute Small-Boat Migrant Smugglers
description: In July 2020, 36-year-old Iraqi Rebwar Ahmed piloted an inflatable small boat carrying 20 migrants across the English Channel.

title: China to Increase Defense Budget to Meet Security Challenge
description: China needs to increase its defense spending to meet “complex security challenges” and “fulfill its responsibility as a major country,” Wang Chao, spokesman for the annual National People’s Congress legislative session, said at a press conference in Beijing Saturday.

title: Hong Kong Court Convicts Activists Behind Tiananmen Vigil
description: HONG KONG (AP) — Three Hong Kong activists from a now-defunct group that organized annual vigils commemorating China’s 1989 crackdown on pro-democracy protesters were convicted on Saturday for failing to provide authorities with information on the group in accordance with a national security law.

title: US Prepares New Rules on Investment in Tech Abroad, WSJ Says
description: The Treasury Department is preparing a new program that could prohibit US investment in certain sectors of adversarial nations, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing copies of reports provided to lawmakers the paper had seen.
